    Function Names and Defaults

    Some functions could be renamed

    MCMC Functions

    getMCMCPar could be renamed estimateSettingsForMCMC to show that these are not binding/mandatory, we are trying to guess sensible values. In addition, lots of things are already named Par, or par, maybe MCMC should have “settings” or “options” to avoid confusion.

    Objectives and Distances

    Are makeAcceptanceProbability and makeObjective intended to be different (one to minimize one to maximize)

    Maybe we do need two different functions of that sort. Objective is not a clear enough word to deduce whether it should be high or low (objectives are just met).

    to minimize

    These functions that we want to minimize are related to the distance between fit and observable data.

    # we should perhaps have a default distance function like this:
defaultDistance<-function(experiment,simulation){
    n<-dim(simulation$func)
    if (errorValues %in% names(experiment)){
        d<-unlist(lapply(1:n[3], function(j) mean(((simulation$func[1,,j]-experiment$outputValues)/experiment$errorValues)^2, na.rm=TRUE)))
    } else {
        d<-unlist(lapply(1:n[3], function(j) mean((abs(simulation$func[1,,j]-experiment$outputValues)), na.rm=TRUE)))
    }
    return(d)
}

makeDistanceMeasure(experiments, modelName, distance=defaultDistance, parMap=identity, mc.cores=detectCores()){
    out <- runModel(experiments, modelName,  parABC, parMap, mc.cores)
    for(i in 1:length(experiments)){
        D<-mclapply(1:length(experiments), function(i) distance(experiments[[i]],out[[i]]),mc.cores=mc.cores)
        }
        return(D)
}

# or simply
makeDistance(experiments, modelName, distance=defaultDistance, parMap=identity, mc.cores=detectCores()) {[...]}
# without "Measure"

    These would return a function that maps parABC (or parMCMC) to a list of values as long as the number of experiments and each list member the size of the number of parameters. defaultDistance returns a vector of distances (one for each parameter vector),

    to maximize

    Here the word Score seems OK.

    makeScore(experiments, modelName, score=defaultScore, parMap=identity, mc.cores=detectCores())

    Sometimes the Score is from Bayesian statistics, then it’s more appropriate to write:

    makeLikelihood(experiments, modelName, distance=defaultDistance, parMap=identity, mc.cores=detectCores())

    Small suggestions related to Data import

    sprintf can sometimes be clearer to read

    example:

     paste(">",inputs_and_initState_ids,sep="")
 sprintf(">%s",inputs_and_initState_ids)

    We could change the output function in the ABC code to always need time vectors

    experiments[[i]][["outputFunction"]] <- function(yy,par=c(default_par,default_input)) {vectorialOutputFunction(0.0, yy, par)}
vectorialOutputFunction
